latex:
A $5\times5$ grid of squares is filled with integers. Call a rectangle \textit{corner-odd} if its sides are grid lines and the sum of the integers in its four corners is an odd number. What is the maximum possible number of corner-odd rectangles within the grid?\\
\\
Note: A rectangles must have four distinct corners to be considered \textit{corner-odd}; i.e. no $1\times k$ rectangle can be \textit{corner-odd} for any positive integer $k$.
